Inner Engineering (Sadhguru)
- Your Highlight on page 23 | location 345-348 | Added on Friday, 31 December 2021 15:56:38

There is something within every human being that dislikes boundaries, that is longing to become boundless. Human nature is such that we always yearn to be something more than what we are right now. No matter how much we achieve, we still want to be something more. If we just looked at this closely, we would realize that this longing is not for more; this longing is for all. We are all seeking to become infinite. The only problem is that we are seeking it in installments.
==========
Inner Engineering (Sadhguru)
- Your Highlight on page 23 | location 348-353 | Added on Friday, 31 December 2021 15:57:01

Imagine that you were locked up in a cubicle of five feet by five feet. However comfortable it is, you would long to be free of it. The next day, if you were released into a larger cubicle of ten feet by ten feet, you would feel great for a while, but soon the same longing to break that boundary would return. It does not matter how large a boundary we set, the moment you become conscious of it, the longing to break it is instinctive. In the East, this longing has been culturally recognized as the highest goal of all human activity and endeavor. Freedom—or mukti or moksha—is seen as the natural longing in every human being and our ultimate destination.
==========
Inner Engineering (Sadhguru)
- Your Highlight on page 23 | location 355-359 | Added on Friday, 31 December 2021 15:57:18

My whole aim since then has been to somehow rub this experience off on other people, to awaken them to the fact that this state of joy, of freedom, of limitlessness cannot be denied to them unless they stand in the way of the natural effervescence of life.

The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 23 | location 615-618 | Added on Thursday, 10 February 2022 17:47:57

Taken further, your confidence regarding any single aspect of your “game” is the total of all the thoughts you have about that aspect (forehand, backhand, first serve, second serve, volleys, etc., for tennis; passing, shooting, checking, etc., for hockey; budgeting, forecasting, employee management, etc., for business).
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 23 | location 618-621 | Added on Thursday, 10 February 2022 17:48:11

But this total of thoughts isn’t a static, once-and-for-all tally. Instead, it changes constantly as each and every new thought and new memory is added to it, making it a “running total,” a momentary sum of everything that you’ve thought about yourself and your abilities, a sum that is always changing depending on (1) how you are thinking at any time, (2) which aspects of your experience you are choosing to focus and linger on at any moment, and (3) how much emotion you invest in which particular thoughts and which particular memories.
==========

==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 24 | location 624-626 | Added on Thursday, 10 February 2022 17:49:39

==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 24 | location 626-628 | Added on Thursday, 10 February 2022 17:49:43

The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 33 | location 733-740 | Added on Friday, 11 February 2022 07:55:53

Second, no matter how you answered these two questions, the good news is that you have a choice point in your thought/performance cycle. No matter the outcome of any particular performance, you can deliberately choose to linger on the proper thoughts about it as well as the proper thoughts about yourself. No matter what the quality of your execution has been and no matter how long you have been maintaining a certain ratio of helpful thoughts to hurtful thoughts, you can choose to change your mind and get yourself on that constructive cycle more and more frequently. When I first started working with Eli Manning in early 2007, he was honest enough to admit that his thoughts about his play were 50/50 “good and not so good.” That ratio changed dramatically over the next ten months, contributing to Eli’s first Super Bowl victory and MVP award. How you can change your ratio and remain more consistently helpful will be described in the following chapters.

The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 42 | location 866-870 | Added on Saturday, 12 February 2022 17:50:16

Unfortunately, I have seen far too many performers choose the damaging sewer option. Why? It probably has to do with your early experiences in performance moments, when you were new to a sport or a task or a situation that you hadn’t yet developed skill or competency at. Being unskilled, it’s likely you experienced relatively little success, and as each of these unsuccessful moments were preceded by your body’s natural adrenaline and arousal, you likely learned to associate this arousal with a soon-to-follow disappointment.

he points out that when you’re “nervous,” your heart races and you envision a future (usually a bad one), but that when you’re “excited,” your heart also races and you also envision a future (usually a pleasant one).
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 43 | location 877-880 | Added on Saturday, 12 February 2022 17:56:36

How we interpret that arousal, the “narrative” we tell ourselves about it, determines whether we feel uncomfortably “nervous” or functionally (maybe even pleasantly) “excited.” We can choose to interpret that arousal as either beneficial or damaging, as either a blessing or a curse. I hope the changing of your personal narrative
==========

- Your Highlight on page 43 | location 882-884 | Added on Saturday, 12 February 2022 17:56:53

reported in USA Today the day after the 2006 Super Bowl, Ward changed his narrative about being nervous when he got some reassurance from another veteran player that it was perfectly okay for him to feel some stomach discomfort prior to such a big moment.

The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 48 | location 949-954 | Added on Sunday, 13 February 2022 06:54:44

Take heart—your investment of “work” is far from pointless, and those long plateaus and short bursts do not mean that you can’t eventually succeed. Everyone else pursuing success—your peers, your competitors, and your opponents—are all experiencing these same realities. If you can accept them and work with them just a little better than they do, you’ll create an advantage for yourself. The way to minimize that frustration and set the stage for your First Victory is to understand that every minute of quality practice, every rep, drill, and practice session properly conducted, creates beneficial changes in your nervous system that ultimately, over time, bring about substantial improvements.

The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 50 | location 969-971 | Added on Sunday, 13 February 2022 06:56:23

Another useful insight into the delayed effects of practice is provided by recent neuroanatomy research demonstrating that the outer sheath of a neuron, the individual nerve cells of which our entire nervous system is composed, grows each time that neuron is activated.13
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 50 | location 971-972 | Added on Sunday, 13 February 2022 06:56:30

Each and every thought, feeling, and action we experience as human beings is brought about by a particular electrical signal traveling
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 50 | location 972-972 | Added on Sunday, 13 February 2022 06:56:33

through a chain of neurons arranged in a complex circuitry.
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 51 | location 981-983 | Added on Sunday, 13 February 2022 06:57:25

“myelin serves as the insulation that wraps these nerve fibers and increases their signal strength, speed, and accuracy.14 The more we fire a particular circuit, the more myelin optimizes that circuit, and the stronger, faster, and more fluent our movements and thoughts become.”
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 51 | location 981-985 | Added on Sunday, 13 February 2022 06:57:33

“myelin serves as the insulation that wraps these nerve fibers and increases their signal strength, speed, and accuracy.14 The more we fire a particular circuit, the more myelin optimizes that circuit, and the stronger, faster, and more fluent our movements and thoughts become.” The more the circuit is fired, the more myelin is produced; and the more myelin produced, the more efficient the circuit becomes.
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 51 | location 987-989 | Added on Sunday, 13 February 2022 06:58:05

faster, smoother, and with more precise timing than before. Once that layer of myelin insulation becomes thick enough, as a result of repeated firings of the neural circuit, the speed of the impulse passing through that circuit increases up to one hundred-fold.
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 51 | location 989-989 | Added on Sunday, 13 February 2022 06:58:43

==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 87 | location 1466-1467 | Added on Tuesday, 15 February 2022 06:58:18

something that is desirable and valuable, rather than minimizes, negates, or denies something you are trying to avoid. This is a crucial difference that many people fail to understand
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 88 | location 1474-1475 | Added on Tuesday, 15 February 2022 06:59:07

All this results in a startling neurological fact—thinking about what you don’t want to happen only reinforces your brain’s familiarity with it, making it only more likely that it will actually happen.
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 88 | location 1477-1480 | Added on Tuesday, 15 February 2022 06:59:33

The more constructive alternative is obvious—carve into your brain the neurology associated with what you want more of—placing that second serve right inside the service line, reaching consensus with your work team, accurately reading the body language of your customers—by talking to yourself in the present tense about what you want more of, phrased as if you already have it or as if it already exists.
==========

Surprisingly and importantly, at a very meaningful level, the human nervous system, that incredibly complex network of neurons, synapses, and chemical transmitters, does not distinguish real stimuli (actual physical reps) from imagined stimuli (mental reps), as long as those imagined stimuli are sufficiently powerful.
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 116 | location 1839-1843 | Added on Sunday, 20 February 2022 22:58:43

Assuming your imagination works like most people’s, and assuming you’ve handled a lemon before, the following things happened when you imagined biting into that imaginary lemon: your nostrils flared, the muscles around your mouth tightened, and you produced some saliva. Why? Because the elements of your autonomic nervous system, which (1) control the action of your facial muscles, (2) initiate digestion, and (3) allow you to taste what is in your mouth, all operated in the absence of an actual lemon.

Keep your envisioning positive! Just as essential is the level of detail
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 123 | location 1940-1944 | Added on Sunday, 20 February 2022 23:09:24

Achieving this high level of detail simply means engaging the maximum number of senses and dialing each one up to their highest intensity. This starts, obviously enough, with maxing the visual details in any imagined scene. Where is it taking place? Indoors? Outdoors? Which room or rooms? If it’s indoors, what do the walls, floors, and ceilings look like? If it’s outdoors, what do the ground, the surroundings, and the sky look like? Can you give the scene exact colors and “see” the position of any equipment, furniture, tools, teammates, opponents, coworkers?
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 124 | location 1944-1947 | Added on Sunday, 20 February 2022 23:09:28

Remember, you are the producer of this movie scene so you can add any details to make it realistic. How about sounds? Is there the background hum of a crowd or audience? Are there vocal cues and commands from teammates or coworkers? Announcements from a PA system? Add these audio details to accompany your sharp and clear pictures. Now take your detailing one step further and add
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)
- Your Highlight on page 124 | location 1949-1960 | Added on Sunday, 20 February 2022 23:10:00

With this enhanced degree of control and detail you can now move to more complex, more sequential, and more breakthrough-related mental images. Part Two: Practicing to Improve With your envisioning muscles now warmed up, let’s give them a little workout that will help you improve a skill that you’ll be using in an upcoming performance. For this exercise, select a technical skill from your sport, or a task you perform in your workday that you would like to improve. Select something that you know you’ll need in an upcoming game or test, or one that is commonly evaluated in your work and one that takes a relatively short time to complete. It could be anything from hitting a more powerful tennis serve (as opposed to playing an entire match), to playing a smoother short piece of music on an instrument (as opposed to playing the entire Third Brandenburg Concerto), to entering data faster into a database (as opposed to completing your entire monthly expense report). Envisioning the execution of this skill or task will initiate activity in the brain’s motor cortex and activate the nervous system pathways that control the task, due to the fact that your nervous system doesn’t distinguish very well between something you actually do and something you vividly imagine doing. With those nervous system pathways activated from motor cortex to spinal cord to your body’s periphery where the nerves connect up with your muscles, you might feel a slight twitch as you envision moving.
==========
The Confident Mind (Zinsser, Nathaniel)

Jesus tells us to contemplate the flowers and learn from them how to live. The Buddha is said to have given a “silent sermon” once during which he held up a flower and gazed at it. After a while, one of those present, a monk called Mahakasyapa, began to smile. He is said to have been the only one who had understood the sermon. According to legend, that smile (that is to say, realization) was handed down by twenty-eight successive masters and much later became the origin of Zen.

A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 35 | location 563-565 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 14:38:48

==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 35 | location 565-566 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 14:38:51

add something to their sense of self.

- Your Highlight on page 36 | location 572-575 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 14:39:54

- Your Highlight on page 36 | location 576-578 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 14:40:21

- Your Highlight on page 39 | location 613-615 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 14:52:19

“Do you realize that you will have to let go of the ring at some point, perhaps quite soon? How much more time do you need before you will be ready to let go of it? Will you become less when you let go of it? Has who you are become diminished by the loss?” There were a few minutes of silence after the last question.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 40 | location 617-620 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 14:52:54

‘Yes, of course you have been diminished.’ Then I asked myself the question again, ‘Has who I am become diminished?’ This time I tried to feel rather than think the answer. And suddenly I could feel my I Am-ness. I have never felt that before. If I can feel the I Am so strongly, then who I am hasn’t been diminished at all. I can still feel it now, something peaceful but very alive.”

==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 43 | location 649-652 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:03:08

A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 43 | location 653-655 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:03:20

What does “poor in spirit” mean? No inner baggage, no identifications. Not with things, nor with any mental concepts that have a sense of self in them. And what is the “kingdom of heaven”? The simple but profound joy of Being that is there when you let go of identifications and so become “poor in spirit.”
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 43 | location 652-655 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:03:36

“Blessed are the poor in spirit,” Jesus said, “for theirs will be the kingdom of heaven.”1 What does “poor in spirit” mean? No inner baggage, no identifications. Not with things, nor with any mental concepts that have a sense of self in them. And what is the “kingdom of heaven”? The simple but profound joy of Being that is there when you let go of identifications and so become “poor in spirit.”
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 43 | location 657-658 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:04:22

will attempt to ensure its survival by finding something else to identity with, for example, a mental image of yourself as someone who has transcended all interest in material possessions and is therefore superior, is more spiritual than others.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 44 | location 660-661 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:04:42

==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 44 | location 666-667 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:08:19

In the days of the white settlement, the natives of North America found ownership of land an incomprehensible concept.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 44 | location 667-669 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:08:26

And so they lost it when the Europeans made them sign pieces of paper that were equally incomprehensible to them. They felt they belonged to the land, but the land did not belong to them.
==========

having with Being: I have, therefore I am.

A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 45 | location 669-670 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:08:59

The ego lives through comparison.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 45 | location 670-670 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:09:03

How you are seen by others turns into how you see yourself.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 45 | location 672-676 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:09:19

How you are seen by others becomes the mirror that tells you what you are like and who you are. The ego’s sense of self-worth is in most cases bound up with the worth you have in the eyes of others. You need others to give you a sense of self, and if you live in a culture that to a large extent equates self-worth with how much and what you have, if you cannot look through this collective delusion, you will be condemned to chasing after things for the rest of your life in the vain hope of finding your worth and completion of your sense of self there.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 45 | location 676-677 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:09:51

How do you let go of attachment to things? Don’t even try. It’s impossible. Attachment to things drops away by itself when you no longer seek to find yourself in them.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 45 | location 677-678 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:10:09

In the meantime, just be aware of your attachment to things. Sometimes you may not know that you are attached to something, which is to say, identified, until you lose it or there is the threat of loss.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 45 | location 678-681 | Added on Saturday, 12 March 2022 15:10:13

If you then become upset, anxious, and so on, it means you are attached. If you are aware that you are identified with a thing, the identification is no longer total. “I am the awareness that is aware that there is attachment.” That’s the beginning of the transformation of consciousness.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)

- Your Bookmark on page 209 | location 3058 | Added on Saturday, 26 March 2022 15:10:17


==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 46 | location 685-686 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:06:02

Since you cannot find yourself through having, however, there is another more powerful drive underneath it that pertains to the structure of the ego: the need for more, which we could also call “wanting.”
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 46 | location 688-689 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:07:20

This is the psychological need for more, that is to say, more things to identify with. It is an addictive need, not an authentic one.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 47 | location 691-691 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:07:35

Their mind is hungry, not their body.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 47 | location 697-698 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:08:28

Unease, restlessness, boredom, anxiety, dissatisfaction, are the result of unfulfilled wanting.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 47 | location 699-700 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:08:53

Intense wanting that has no specific object can often be found in the still-developing ego of teenagers, some of whom are in a permanent state of negativity and dissatisfaction.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 48 | location 704-706 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:09:32

The thought forms of “me” and “mine,” of “more than,” of “I want,” “I need,” “I must have,” and of
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 48 | location 706-706 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:09:36

“not enough” pertain not to content but to the structure of the ego. The
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 48 | location 706-708 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:12:07

“not enough” pertain not to content but to the structure of the ego. The content is interchangeable. As long as you don’t recognize those thought forms within yourself, as long as they remain unconscious, you will believe in what they say; you will be condemned to acting out those
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 50 | location 730-731 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:13:54

To be more precise, they derive their identity from the I-thought that they erroneously attach to the mental image or concept of their body, which after all is no more than a physical form that shares the destiny of all
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 50 | location 731-732 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:13:58

forms—impermanence and ultimately decay.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 51 | location 735-736 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:14:37

you don’t equate the body with who you are, when beauty fades, vigor diminishes, or the body becomes incapacitated, this will not affect your sense of worth or identity in any
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 51 | location 741-742 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:15:02

You then unconsciously cling to the illness because it has become the most important part of who you perceive yourself to be. It has become another thought form with which the ego can identify.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 51 | location 742-744 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:15:07

Once the ego has found an identity, it does not want to let go. Amazingly but not infrequently, the ego in search of a stronger identity can and does create illnesses in order to strengthen itself through them.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Bookmark on page 52 | location 747 | Added on Sunday, 27 March 2022 23:16:28


==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 756-757 | Added on Monday, 28 March 2022 23:00:59

What I call the “inner body” isn’t really the body anymore but life energy, the bridge between form and formlessness.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 759-760 | Added on Monday, 28 March 2022 23:01:30

This is to say, you are no longer identified with form but moving away from form-identification toward formlessness, which we may also call Being.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 760-762 | Added on Monday, 28 March 2022 23:01:43

It is your essence identity. Body awareness not only anchors you in the present moment, it is a doorway out of the prison that is the ego. It also strengthens the immune system and the body’s ability to heal itself.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 763-763 | Added on Tuesday, 12 April 2022 21:21:09

Ego is always identification with form,
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 763-763 | Added on Tuesday, 12 April 2022 21:21:14

seeking yourself and thereby losing yourself in some form.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)

Forms are not just material objects and physical bodies. More fundamental than the external forms—things and bodies—are the thought forms that continuously arise in the field of consciousness. They
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 763-768 | Added on Tuesday, 12 April 2022 21:21:44

Forms are not just material objects and physical bodies. More fundamental than the external forms—things and bodies—are the thought forms that continuously arise in the field of consciousness. They are energy formations, finer and less dense than physical matter, but they are forms nonetheless. What you may be aware of as a voice in your head that never stops speaking is the stream of incessant and compulsive thinking. When every thought absorbs your attention completely, when you are so identified with the voice in your head and the emotions that accompany it that you lose yourself in every thought and every emotion, then
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 54 | location 768-770 | Added on Tuesday, 12 April 2022 21:22:00

Ego is a conglomeration of recurring thought forms and conditioned mental-emotional patterns that are invested with a sense of I, a sense of self. Ego arises when your sense of Beingness, of “I Am,” which is formless consciousness, gets mixed up with form. This is the meaning of identification.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 54 | location 770-771 | Added on Tuesday, 12 April 2022 21:24:35

This is forgetfulness of Being, the primary error, the illusion of absolute separateness that turns reality into a nightmare.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 54 | location 774-776 | Added on Tuesday, 12 April 2022 21:25:27

A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 57 | location 806-809 | Added on Wednesday, 13 April 2022 21:43:51

Yielding means inner acceptance of what is. You are open to life. Resistance is an inner contraction, a hardening of the shell of the ego. You are closed. Whatever action you take in a state of inner resistance (which we could also call negativity) will create more outer resistance, and the universe will not be on your side; life will not be helpful. If the shutters are closed, the sunlight cannot come in.
==========
A New Earth (Tolle, Eckhart)
- Your Highlight on page 58 | location 809-812 | Added on Wednesday, 13 April 2022 21:43:58

When you yield internally, when you surrender, a new dimension of consciousness opens up. If action is possible or necessary, your action will be in alignment with the whole and supported by creative intelligence, the unconditioned consciousness which in a state of inner openness you become one with. Circumstances and people then become helpful, cooperative. Coincidences happen. If no action is possible, you rest in the peace and inner stillness that come with surrender. You rest in God.

In these pages, you will read stories to help you curate a deeper understanding of how boundary issues appear in real life. They are fictionalized versions of my interactions with clients. All names, identifying facts, and details have been changed to maintain anonymity. I hope you find yourself in these stories of others and learn how to shift your relationships.

- Your Highlight on page 5 | location 223-227 | Added on Monday, 2 May 2022 16:32:22

Neglecting self-care is the first thing to happen when we get caught up in our desire to help others. I can’t tell you how many people show up in my office lamenting, “I don’t have time to do anything for myself.” After a quick evaluation, it becomes apparent that these people are not making any time for themselves. In fact, it often seems like they’ve forgotten how to take care of themselves. They can’t manage to carve out time to eat a healthy meal or find five minutes to meditate, but they spend hours volunteering at their kids’ school every week. This type of imbalance
==========

- Your Highlight on page 5 | location 227-228 | Added on Monday, 2 May 2022 16:32:29

is an immediate sign of boundary issues.

Disappearing, ignoring, or cutting people off is avoidance. Not responding to a request, delaying setting the record straight, or failing to show up are ways that we avoid situations instead of dealing with them proactively.
==========
Set Boundaries, Find Peace: A Guide to Reclaiming Yourself (Tawwab, Nedra Glover)
- Your Highlight on page 7 | location 258-261 | Added on Saturday, 7 May 2022 23:09:44

Avoidance is a passive-aggressive way of expressing that you are tired of showing up. Hoping the problem will go away feels like the safest option, but avoidance is a fear-based response. Avoiding a discussion of our expectations doesn’t prevent conflict. It prolongs the inevitable task of setting boundaries.
==========

- Your Highlight on page 8 | location 261-263 | Added on Saturday, 7 May 2022 23:09:55

created a small excel sheet application that after inputting all of someone’s goals, automatically generated over 100 meals perfectly suited to their macronutrient and calorie needs. Better yet, depending which meals they selected, would tell them what they needed to buy at the grocery store in exact amounts, and how to prepare them in bulk for their exact amounts. It took me about 100 hours to put the whole thing together. But from that point going forward I sold truly personalized eating plans for very expensive prices, but they only took me about 15 minutes to make. High value. Low cost.

To Sell is Human (Pink, Daniel H)
- Your Highlight on page 132 | location 1595-1596 | Added on Friday, 28 July 2023 10:49:52

Identifying problems as a way to move others takes two longstanding skills and turns them upside down.
==========
To Sell is Human (Pink, Daniel H)
- Your Highlight on page 132 | location 1596-1601 | Added on Friday, 28 July 2023 10:50:09

First, in the past, the best salespeople were adept at accessing information. Today, they must be skilled at curating it—sorting through the massive troves of data and presenting to others the most relevant and clarifying pieces. Second, in the past, the best salespeople were skilled at answering questions (in part because they had information their prospects lacked). Today, they must be good at asking questions—uncovering possibilities, surfacing latent issues, and finding unexpected problems. And one question in particular sits at the top of the list.
==========
To Sell is Human (Pink, Daniel H)

This is why curation is so important, especially in a world saturated with options and alternatives. Framing people’s options in a way that restricts their choices can help them see those choices more clearly instead of overwhelming them. What Mies van der Rohe said of designing buildings is equally true of moving those who inhabit them: Less is more.
==========

a result, framing a sale in experiential terms is more likely to lead to satisfied customers and repeat business. - Your Highlight on page 23 | location 476-478 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:01:51

‘The doc said I’d need surgery but it could wait. So for the rest of the season I had a series of let’s just say “not-very-nice” weekly injections in my hip so I could play. In training, I gritted it out. I never said a word about the pain to anyone but the doc.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 24 | location 479-480 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:02:09

felt like a piece of meat being processed. I just turned off and did my job.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 24 | location 481-483 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:02:20

‘That same year, we won the final. And I got to lift that trophy. I remember being in the changing room after the game and looking at a sign on the wall that said, “there is no finish line”. I thought, “I wish there fucking was.”

Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 24 | location 483-484 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:02:28

Everyone was cracking beers and carrying on, all smiles and singing, I joined in but all I felt was empty. I didn’t even feel like me any more. Maybe I was a bit depressed, maybe I’m just soft, or maybe I am “weak”.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 24 | location 485-487 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:02:47

Paul’s career is a classic case of winning shallow. His joy in playing – and eventually in life – was extinguished by the fear-mongering culture of his club.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 24 | location 487-489 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:03:02

Could you be winning shallow? Often, the clue is that you feel burned out, like Paul. Do you sense you’ve lost your excitement or joy in life? Bored? As if you’re going through the motions? Maybe you used to take huge pleasure in playing sport or another activity, but that’s gone?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 24 | location 489-490 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:03:16

We lose our way when our lives are underpinned by either wanting to be better than others or wanting to avoid being rejected by others. There
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 25 | location 492-493 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:03:27

The first question to ask yourself is: do you think about success in terms of upward gains, continually acquiring more and doing better?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 25 | location 496-497 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:03:49

This kind of one-upmanship has its most recent roots in the eighties, when the idea emerged that what we have is more important than who we are.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 25 | location 497-497 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:03:56

what you have can never be enough.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 25 | location 498-499 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:04:06

But when he got there, and even when his team lifted the trophy, he didn’t feel the joy he’d expected.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 25 | location 500-500 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:04:14

Fear had left him anxious and isolated.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 25 | location 500-502 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:04:23

Fear uses up all the space we might have for broader, less gain-oriented ambitions: maybe you would have loved to have played the piano more, or learned to skateboard, or become a painter rather than an accountant?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 25 | location 502-503 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:04:33

The school system feeds into this: we are most often marked on academic results, rather than the broader qualities that might help us find real fulfilment.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 26 | location 504-505 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:04:47

really shouldn’t be. The human psyche is an ecosystem that thrives when it is rich and diverse, not driven towards constant upgrades.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 26 | location 505-506 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:04:53

you are always trying to reach and demonstrate success, you are missing out on the journey, on experiencing yourself and others and exploring the world.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 26 | location 506-509 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:05:08

Think about this: how much of your attention and mind is consumed with looking good enough, with making it seem like you’re OK in everybody else’s eyes? Perhaps you may think of yourself as too cool to keep up with the Joneses, but isn’t being cool just another way to measure yourself? And is comparison really what you want to spend your precious energy on? Are you leaving any room for who else you might be?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 26 | location 509-510 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:05:24

the flip side, maybe you tell yourself you’re a failure or a loser because you haven’t achieved the status markers: the relationship, the house, the career, the baby.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 26 | location 510-512 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:05:32

==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 26 | location 513-515 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:05:39

The second question to ask yourself is: do you feel that if someone else wins, you are more likely to lose? Believing that success is scarce and limited makes you want to be better than the next person, to think you have to fight tooth and nail for success.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 27 | location 518-519 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:11:38

it is the ego’s need to be better than the next guy and the fear of not having or being enough.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 27 | location 521-523 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:11:57

You’ll know you’re in a scarcity mentality when you can only think of yourself and your own interests, or those of your tribe (the people you see as like you in some way). Without realising it, that scarcity-scrap to be good enough and to have enough can shape your mentality into one of dominance, self-focus and must-conquer.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 27 | location 525-527 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:26:55

In your mind it might not feel enough just to win: you want to smash, outstrip, out-run, squash and annihilate any possibility that you are not good enough, to prove beyond doubt that you are not a loser and get yourself on to safe ground.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 27 | location 528-529 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:27:05

turns a desire to win from being good for the soul and a product of us at our best into a neurotic, desperate, and pretty ugly need. And when you go from desire to need, the underlying
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 27 | location 529-530 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:36:55

reason is fear.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 28 | location 530-531 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:37:07

Many people believe having this kind of desperation is a good motivator. That’s how Paul’s coach operated. And it explains these ‘motivational’ mantras: ‘No rest’, ‘Be afraid’, ‘There is no finish line’.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 28 | location 531-533 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:37:33

By contrast, consider the New Zealand All Blacks, arguably the world’s greatest team in any sport. The All Blacks player Brad Thorn has a simple mantra: ‘Champions do extra’. Can you feel a profoundly different tone? That is the difference between fear and desire.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 28 | location 534-535 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:37:57

reduced to one ultra-specific goal, such as winning a World Cup, beating a commercial competitor or getting a dream job, it’s winning shallow.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 28 | location 535-537 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:38:02

And not winning means being a failure. Then, it doesn’t take long for the soul and purpose to be squashed out of winning altogether, replaced by the fear of being that failure.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 28 | location 537-538 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:45:35

You may have all the trophies in the cabinet or all the gold stars on your résumé, but unless you can take the reins back from fear, you cannot win deep.

- Your Highlight on page 28 | location 539-540 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:45:45

==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 28 | location 540-541 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 09:45:57

==========

==========

- Your Highlight on page 36 | location 622-623 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 16:51:01

==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 36 | location 629-630 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 16:55:53

real life, constant fear is simply too exhausting and distracting to be a good motivator.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 36 | location 630-631 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 16:55:59

That’s because your attention is finite, and the more attention you spend worrying about scary negative consequences, the less attention you have to give to your actual performance.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 36 | location 631-632 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 16:56:02

==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 36 | location 632-633 | Added on Saturday, 5 August 2023 16:56:54

Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)

==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)

Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)

that ‘survival of the fittest’ means one animal’s ability to conquer another

Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 51 | location 808-810 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 21:58:10

You’ll likely feel uneasy making suggestions that might be considered off topic and off brand. You can’t challenge the existing plans. You might receive feedback such as, ‘This sounds a bit loose’ or ‘Show me where this has worked previously’.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 52 | location 812-812 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 21:58:54

What this creates is a veil of control, so you make sure you don’t do anything that might be judged as stupid.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 52 | location 813-814 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 21:59:02

In meetings in high-control organisations, you might carefully avoid being too personal. You’ll
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 52 | location 814-816 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 21:59:10

make sure you’re presenting your ideas in a structured, conforming and data-reliant style. And you’ll shut down your imagination, stop thinking about what’s possible or could be improved or changed, as it’ll feel too scary to be in any way controversial.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 52 | location 816-817 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 21:59:23

Their fear is that if people are given even an inch of freedom, they will slack off.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 52 | location 819-821 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 21:59:46

these sorts of organisations, you have to fit in, not stand out. You comply, not defy. You are also supposed to ‘stay in your lane’ rather than stray over into anyone else’s area with ideas or imagination. In systems like this, the central energy is anxiety and you end up paying far too much mental rent.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 825-826 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:01:02

this kind of organisation, you may feel you’re being treated like a robot, or a cog in a machine.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 826-827 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:01:09

It’s as if human beings are just a component part of the system rather than the point of the system, as if we are merely results-maximisers focused on gaining a competitive advantage.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 828-828 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:01:22

The vibe you get is that you should be grateful to work for this company, to have this job.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 828-829 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:01:29

And you’d better swallow the values and the norms wholesale, because if you want to think differently, you’re in trouble.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 829-830 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:01:46

If this is your family vibe, there might be a matriarch or patriarch who – overtly or by stealth – overinfluences the other family members’ lives. In a team,
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 830-831 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:01:55

that you are lucky to play for them, so you should shut up and be grateful.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 832-833 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:02:06

The coach said it looked ‘sloppy’ and he wanted his players to look professional. Not only is this culturally unconscious, it screams of power and ownership. It
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 833-835 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:02:11

says, ‘you’d better look and feel like me, or else’. Even if the players were to conform, something would be for ever sanitised in the player–coach relationship; the personal is lost. And performance is nothing if not personal. (That coach didn’t last, by the way.)
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 835-837 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:02:25

There is a poverty that comes from insisting on uniformity. Something beautiful is lost when you try to control people’s individuality, make everything and everyone the same shape and size culturally and in their character.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 53 | location 838-839 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:02:34

So what if a player wants one sock up and one sock down during a game, or a gymnast wants to wear a mohawk?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 54 | location 839-841 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:02:45

Why do we feel the need to wear shirts and ties that project faceless similarity and conformity? What would happen if you came to work as you? Would it mean you were less hidden, more exposed? Would it be scary to just be yourself?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 54 | location 842-843 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:03:28

Instead, you feel like you constantly need to deliver results. The main casualties of this? Your imagination and creativity.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 54 | location 843-843 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:03:38

The other casualties, which you might not expect, are honesty and good behaviour.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Bookmark on page 53 | location 837 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:03:45


==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 54 | location 845-846 | Added on Tuesday, 8 August 2023 22:04:08

Because obeying rules isn’t the same as buying-in. Even if you do what’s expected, it will be temporary, fake and forced.

==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)

we want to win deep and live with less fear and more freedom.

Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 56 | location 868-869 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:11:22

This is not just me advising, ‘Be brave’. Some people won’t be able to speak up. You may not be in a position to make any kind of stand or challenge.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 57 | location 875-875 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:11:57

There’s no blame here; the old ways of talking about success run deep. But please know that there is a better way you can lead,
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 57 | location 875-876 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:12:01

one where the result will be more fulfilment. And that’s better for performance and results, too. Win–win.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 59 | location 886-886 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:13:03

may have shrunk you, so you have stayed small in some ways, limiting your potential and what you can achieve.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 59 | location 886-888 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:13:13

Fear can also stiffen you into rigid over-control of yourself and the people around you. And it can also push you into painful, burning shame. All of these things send you down a rabbit hole away from your real potential as a human being.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 60 | location 888-891 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:13:52

While what is about to follow may sound dark and gloomy, I hope it will give you insight into particular areas of your life to look at, clues to look out for. Because once you recognise that what you’re experiencing is fear-based, you will be able to think about how best to use the ideas in the second part of the book, to help you overcome that fear.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 60 | location 892-893 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:14:01

You shrink. (It would have been better to name psychologists like me ‘anti-shrinks’, because we want you to do the opposite!)
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 60 | location 896-897 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:14:26

And even when you do have time off, you don’t relax.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 60 | location 897-897 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:14:31

If this is you, you’ll have the sense that having a good time will get in the way of success.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 60 | location 897-899 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:14:36

You may think prioritising fun is slacking off and you’ll get caught out. Or it’s a sign of low willpower and a lack of self-discipline.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 900-901 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:14:49

Fun becomes only a distraction or a reprieve from the real purpose of life, which is avoiding not being good enough.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 901-902 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:15:04

this really how you want to live? Can you think of a way that your life would be worse if you had a good time?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 901-901 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:15:10

Is
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 902-903 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:15:34

Fun, especially fun with people you trust, gives you a pop of feel-good chemicals and hormones.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 903-905 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:15:53

These include pleasurable endorphins, rewarding dopamine and maybe a side-order of loved-up oxytocin. By lowering tension and increasing positivity, fun enhances performance. And the relief it brings helps to stop you burning out from overwork, too.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 905-905 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:16:10

Play comes naturally to us all. It switches us out of performance mode and makes us feel we can be free to be who we truly are.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 907-908 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:16:25

But don’t let fear close the door on the very best stuff of life.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 908-909 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:16:50

Fear might be the reason you keep yourself small and out of the way. You want to make sure you don’t fail or get hurt.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 909-910 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:17:08

this is you, you’re reluctant to speak up, settling instead for stagnant comfort.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 910-911 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:17:24

Fear makes you avoid what feels challenging. It wants you to get through the day and not have to delve into difficult emotions.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 61 | location 911-911 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:17:35

You may unwittingly avoid great parts of yourself being seen, or exposed, in exchange for this easier life.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 62 | location 913-916 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:18:07

Each of us draws the boundaries of what’s realistic in our lives: how much we can earn, what work we can do, where we can live, the level of education we can reach. And although some of us have more practical limitations – for example, money, children, illness, elderly parents – most of us largely stay within our self-created limits.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 62 | location 916-917 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:18:25

Ask yourself: who drew those boundaries for me? Did I inherit an expectation to do a certain job, live in a particular place, have a set number of children? Is it fear that’s making my boundaries too narrow?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 62 | location 920-920 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:18:49

Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 62 | location 920-921 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:18:53

deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 62 | location 921-922 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:19:04

is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 62 | location 922-924 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:19:12

Personal growth is often presented as linear, about ticking off set goals. But it’s more useful to imagine it as a journey. It’s about broadening, deepening and expanding, rather than just improving.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 62 | location 924-924 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:19:16

About growing out and not just up.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 63 | location 926-927 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:19:36

Wayfarers choose to get off the conventional path to success to expand, grow and have new experiences.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 63 | location 932-934 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:20:12

Among other things Dweck showed that if schoolchildren believe they can get smarter, they try harder for longer, and so end up doing better than those who think intelligence is fixed.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 64 | location 945-946 | Added on Thursday, 10 August 2023 23:21:11

Another way you can recognise a low-trust environment is the existence of in-groups who have their own knowledge and privileges.

==========

==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 63 | location 934-936 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:16:00

The passion for stretching yourself and sticking to it, even (or especially) when it’s not going well, is the hallmark of growth mindset. This is the mindset that allows people to thrive during some of the most challenging times of their lives.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 63 | location 936-938 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:16:11

Try looking through the lens of the growth mindset at all the areas you’d like to improve, expand and change. If you believe you can become smarter, wiser, kinder, more compassionate, you up the chances.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 64 | location 940-942 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:16:28

Making any change takes courage. Setting off to achieve anything is about risk and uncertainty and also fear. But it’s worth doing: it’s an extraordinary gift to be able to welcome growth in all directions.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 64 | location 943-944 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:16:39

When fear is dialled up, trust goes down. If you work or spend time in an environment like this, it can feel like people are out for themselves.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 64 | location 952-953 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:18:40

The koru symbol, seen in Māori art, is based on the fern. Its spiral shape conveys the idea that even while it’s opening outwards, there’s a connection back to where it started.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 64 | location 947-948 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:20:00

Even if you are well liked and well accepted, when people who don’t fit in are targeted or mocked, for example, being excluded from important information or even after-work drinks, trust gets paper-thin and fear gets a boost.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 64 | location 948-949 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:20:06

It raises the spectre that, one day, the excluded person could be you.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 65 | location 954-956 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:20:38

Our goals are usually achieved alongside others. So apart from being draining, low trust limits you extending yourself and taking risks towards your goals.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 65 | location 958-959 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:24:33

root, when you are thinking about someone else’s opinion of you, you are feeling the fear that you’re not good enough.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 65 | location 959-961 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:24:45

Mental freedom is the direct opposite of this fear. It’s those rare and welcome moments when we are liberated from others’ opinions. It’s psychological spaciousness where you can apply yourself to whatever you want, or simply rest, without worry-traffic clogging up your mind.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 65 | location 965-966 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:25:07

You have to keep working to balance letting go of unhelpful thoughts and acting. And you have to avoid getting caught in the Venus flytrap of your fearful mind and getting distracted.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 66 | location 969-970 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:25:21

Mental freedom works to fight fear because acceptance of the present moment and fear cannot coexist. Fear is
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 66 | location 970-971 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:25:54

about what might go wrong in the future, even if that future is only seconds away.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 66 | location 971-974 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:26:12

Just as blinking clears your vision, constantly returning your mind to the present clears it. But you have to actively choose to clear your mind, rather than succumb to the incessant river of chatter and nonsense. In fact, you’ll always have to do this. But it’s not a big deal, just a process of taking a deep exhale, checking where your attention is and bringing it back.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 66 | location 976-978 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:26:29

Expectations are the power behind your ambitions. Expectations set your course and help you believe, and help sprout the green shoots of your potential. When your expectations are limited, you may settle for less and stay under the ceiling that’s set for you (or by you).
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 67 | location 978-980 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:26:53

This can happen when specialness is overplayed. The idea takes hold that only certain types of exceptional beings can do something, and everyone else is likely to be underwhelming – you included. This fuels your fear of failure.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 67 | location 980-982 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:27:05

Across elite sport, I’ve spoken to a lot of very capable women who’ve told me how hard it is not to get pulled down by other’s low expectations of what’s possible in a male-dominated world. They
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 67 | location 983-984 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:27:15

When their success is explained in terms of specialness (you’re different), this pressures the woman to stay in line, not to make waves and risk their ‘privileged’ spot.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 67 | location 984-987 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:28:12

Another way expectations are edited is when categories of people are seen as more than, or less than others because of the biases we have and unconscious judgements we make. Sometimes these are on the basis of skin colour, ethnicity, nationality, gender identity or socio-economic background. These are all qualities that have nothing to do with talent and the ability to be a winner.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 68 | location 998-999 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:34:39

Disability is not a brave struggle or ‘courage in the face of adversity’. Disability is an art. It is an ingenious way to live.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 68 | location 999-1000 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:34:48

When no one expects anything much of us, we quit more quickly and limit our possibilities under the heading ‘not for my kind’.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 68 | location 1001-1001 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:34:55

Don’t wait for someone else to rewrite yours. The people who are
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 68 | location 1001-1002 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:34:59

holding the mic don’t always want to share it.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 69 | location 1003-1005 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:35:12

‘the kind of person they are’ can be a winner. Low expectations are different from low self-esteem. Low self-esteem says, ‘I’m not good enough’, while low expectations say, ‘People like me are not good enough’. Examples might be:
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 1019-1020 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:38:43

Expectations aren’t about variations in talent. After all, different activities require different capabilities. They are about keeping hold of your possibilities even while admiring incredible others.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 1020-1022 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:38:47

Try not to put a limit on what you think you are capable of. And don’t shut down, stay small or chase less because you’re not sure that you should be in the arena. Excellence can be found anywhere.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 1022-1023 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:38:57

While fear limits are a relatively direct effect of living in a fear culture, shame runs deeper.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 1023-1024 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:39:06

You have to be primed for it, have had early experiences that tell you that you are unworthy, bad or wrong in the core of your very being.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 1024-1026 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:39:20

That doesn’t mean shame is unusual, because that early experience doesn’t have to be an extreme one: it can be as commonplace as regularly being publicly told off or shown up.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 1026-1027 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:39:31

that has happened to you, you’ll always be ready to experience shame, the acute rush of humiliation and distress that comes from feeling like you are not enough.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 1027-1028 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:40:27

the plain old disappointment of failing with a much more damaging flare-up of shame.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 71 | location 1030-1031 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:40:37

And even though your shame is unlikely to be shown on television,
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 71 | location 1036-1038 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:41:12

was asked to write a culture review on the team just after they returned. My conclusion was that although the athletes were out of order, the deeper issues lay with long-term problems in the organisation, leadership and the toxic culture.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 71 | location 1039-1040 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:43:19

Why do we think shaming someone will change their behaviour or is the best way to rectify the situation? Because it does neither.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 71 | location 1040-1042 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:43:26

There are less lazy methods of helping people to change their behaviour, such as connection and care. Indeed, that was the kind of positive guidance that was missing from the Australian swim team and has been addressed since.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 71 | location 1042-1044 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:44:08

Brené Brown taught us in her TED Talk ‘Listening to Shame’,3 shame isn’t the same as guilt. In her words, guilt is ‘sorry I made a mistake’ while shame is ‘sorry, I am a mistake’.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 72 | location 1044-1045 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:44:20

Guilt is useful because it keeps us aligned with our best selves. It’s when you feel bad for doing something that you shouldn’t have, or not doing something that you should have. And
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 72 | location 1048-1049 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:44:40

Guilt can be a strong emotion, but if you can make up or apologise for what you did or didn’t do, it allows you to make amends and do better.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 72 | location 1049-1050 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:44:46

Shame, on the other hand, can make you feel completely worthless to your core and erode your self-esteem. You can see why we hate to feel it. And to feel it, you don’t have to have done anything at all.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 72 | location 1053-1055 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:45:18

Both the swimmers and the cricketers did the wrong thing; they knew that and so did we. Guilt and an apology would be appropriate here. But because of their humiliating television appearances, and all the negative attention they received, their guilt risked turning inwards, into shame.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 72 | location 1055-1057 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:45:35

Most of the time, shame and anxiety go hand in hand. If you anticipate a situation where you might feel shame – one where there’s a possibility of rejection, such as a date, presenting an idea at work, meeting a new partner’s family – this can pre-fuel your fear of not being good enough, so you want to get away or hide.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 73 | location 1057-1058 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:45:39

Before athletes perform, they can already be thinking about the embarrassment and shame they’ll feel if don’t succeed.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 73 | location 1058-1061 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:45:50

organisation that uses guilt to motivate might tell you that you didn’t make the grade because you didn’t put in the work and this is what you need to do about it. One that uses shame will tell you that you didn’t make the grade because you are not good enough. And it may compound the shame by doing this in public.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Bookmark on page 73 | location 1058 | Added on Wednesday, 16 August 2023 22:46:11

Khan, who was still close enough to hear every word, went rigid. He had, of course, heard of Jason Bourne.

==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 74 | location 1075-1076 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:05:10

During the session, the coach brings out a six-foot-high laminated chart with every athlete on the team ranked in order of BMI.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 74 | location 1078-1079 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:05:28

The players blush and are clearly uncomfortable, but they mumble through their answers, which he takes as a sign of them being sufficiently embarrassed – shamed – to change.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 74 | location 1081-1082 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:06:03

While some manage to lower their BMI in the following weeks, some also report feeling on tenterhooks and wanting to avoid the coach.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 75 | location 1086-1088 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:08:19

As you can see from Team B’s response, shaming isn’t a good teacher or motivator. It’s too painful. When your greatest need is to avoid shame, you’re not worried about right and wrong, you’re worried about self-protection.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 75 | location 1090-1090 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:08:34

But when someone makes a mistake, we shouldn’t keep feeding on their pain.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 75 | location 1092-1093 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:08:44

a culture that’s fuelled by fear, another common way to deal with pressure is over
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 75 | location 1094-1096 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:08:58

Our attempt to take control can take lots of different forms. We may become overly controlling of ourselves, make sure we are perfect, or judge ourselves harshly against rigid standards. Or we may become inflexible with other people and so judge or manipulate them too.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 75 | location 1093-1094 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:09:06

We do this because we never want to be caught out, to be criticised or, even worse, have to experience the corrosive emotion of shame.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 76 | location 1098-1100 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:10:36

Ideally, control offers a counterweight to your impulses, moods and distractibility. It allows you to be productive, keeps your ambitions and efforts focused. It is closely linked with discipline, another tool that ensures you stick to the right codes, rules and routines for the best outcomes. Both of these are excellent mechanisms to use, but not to be used by.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 76 | location 1100-1102 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:10:47

However, when your head is full of not-good-enough fear, your way of compensating might be to work so damn hard that you cannot fail. Control tightens up and discipline becomes your religion.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 76 | location 1102-1103 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:10:53

Other people might say to you, ‘Shouldn’t you take a break?’ or ‘Why don’t you take a day off?’ And you might think, ‘Are you kidding?’ If you are in control mode,
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 76 | location 1103-1105 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:10:58

rest is a luxury. Distraction, entertainment and numbing yourself with TV, alcohol or whatever does it for you will give you some respite … but rest? That would be ridiculous.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 76 | location 1105-1107 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:11:17

You might turn these inflexible high standards outwards towards other people, too: becoming the boss who never lets up and emails her team every evening, the parent who pushes his child too hard, the friend who judges others for not keeping up to their own high standards of grooming or housekeeping or fitness.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 77 | location 1107-1108 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:11:32

How can you tell the difference between passionate productivity and fear-generated discipline?
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 77 | location 1108-1109 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:11:37

You’re full of creativity, ideas and imagination.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 77 | location 1111-1113 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:11:56

I’ve lived this feeling. In my early to mid-thirties (I’m now 49), I decided to take up distance running. This can offer you fantastic mental and physical challenges. For me, though, running quickly combined my anxious over-productivity and my controlling need to prove myself.
==========
Fear Less (Grange, Pippa)
- Your Highlight on page 77 | location 1113-1115 | Added on Monday, 21 August 2023 22:13:49

Prisoners of Geography (Marshall, Tim)
- Your Highlight on page 68 | location 938-941 | Added on Wednesday, 6 September 2023 08:31:01

The Appalachians, 1,500 miles long, are impressive, but compared to the Rockies, not particularly high. Nevertheless, they still formed a formidable barrier to westward movement for the early settlers, who were busy consolidating what territory they had subdued and preparing to govern it themselves. The colonists had another barrier, this one political. The British government forbade settlement west of the Appalachians as it wanted to ensure that trade, and taxes, remained on the Eastern seaboard.

Prisoners of Geography (Marshall, Tim)

- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 957-960 | Added on Wednesday, 6 September 2023 08:33:44

The land stretched from the Gulf of Mexico north-west up to the headwaters of the tributaries of the Mississippi River in the Rocky Mountains. It was an area equivalent in size to modern-day Spain, Italy, France, the UK and Germany combined. With it came the Mississippi basin, from which flowed America’s route to greatness.
==========
Prisoners of Geography (Marshall, Tim)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 960-962 | Added on Wednesday, 6 September 2023 08:33:56

At the stroke of a pen, and the handing over of $15 million, the Louisiana Purchase of 1803 doubled the size of the USA and gave it mastery over the greatest inland water transport route in the world. As the American historian Henry Adams wrote, ‘Never did the United States get so much for so little.’
==========
Prisoners of Geography (Marshall, Tim)
- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 962-963 | Added on Wednesday, 6 September 2023 08:34:11

The greater Mississippi basin has more miles of navigable inland waterways than the rest of the world put together

- Your Highlight on page 70 | location 965-966 | Added on Wednesday, 6 September 2023 08:36:52

Prisoners of Geography (Marshall, Tim)
- Your Highlight on page 72 | location 983-986 | Added on Wednesday, 6 September 2023 08:46:06

1821 that was different. Mexico controlled land all the way up to northern California, which the USA could live with, but it also stretched out east, including what is now Texas which, then as now, borders Louisiana. Mexico’s population at the time was 6.2 million, the USA’s 9.6 million. The US army may have been able to see off the mighty British, but they had been fighting 3,000 miles from home with supply lines across an ocean. The Mexicans were next door.

Prisoners of Geography (Marshall, Tim)
- Your Highlight on page 72 | location 990-993 | Added on Wednesday, 6 September 2023 08:47:00

While the infiltration of Texas was going on, Washington issued the ‘Monroe Doctrine’ (named after President James Monroe) in 1823. This boiled down to warning the European powers that they could no longer seek land in the Western Hemisphere, and that if they lost any parts of their existing territory they could not reclaim them. Or else.

- Your Highlight on page 29 | location 369-370 | Added on Wednesday, 27 September 2023 11:31:07

==========

- Your Highlight on page 970 | location 14218-14219 | Added on Wednesday, 27 September 2023 12:20:03

different class of channels opens in the membrane of the hillock, which allows a massive migration of ions, producing, finally, a positive charge (about 30 mV).

- Your Highlight on page 970 | location 14220-14221 | Added on Wednesday, 27 September 2023 12:20:18

==========
Behave (Sapolsky, Robert M)
- Your Highlight on page 975 | location 14283-14284 | Added on Wednesday, 27 September 2023 12:29:23

==========
Behave (Sapolsky, Robert M)
- Your Highlight on page 976 | location 14294-14296 | Added on Wednesday, 27 September 2023 12:30:42

The second option is for the neurotransmitter to be degraded in the synapse by an enzyme, with the breakdown products flushed out to sea (i.e., the extracellular environment, and from there on to the cerebrospinal fluid, the bloodstream, and eventually the bladder).
